Posts.Content: Jan 5, 2008 04:05PM - edited Jan 5, 2008 04:08PM by Nae Thanks Mary Jo.  The entire reconstructed side is tender to touch around the perimeter of the tram flap.  Almost like irritated tissue underneath.  It seems that I did not get this irritation until I started working out and exercising more.  I wander if the nodes are reacting to sore muscle tissue.   I also have one node to show up on the non-cancerous side and it never changes in size.  That side was lifted and can feel tender from time to time.  Doc thinks it is absolutely not cancer on the left side. anyway thanks for your letter.  I feel much better. nae
Posts.Title: pet scan "false positive"? kimjct Nae

Posts.Content: Jan 7, 2008 05:27AM Nae wrote: nileshbshah I agree with Twink.  I found my recurrences and all of my tests were fine.  Pay close attention to your wife (looks like you are doing that) and please try to reduce stress in her life.  My husband has never followed the advice.

Posts.Content: Jan 3, 2008 05:04PM Nae wrote: PET scan show nodes outside the perimeter of tram breast reconstruction are enlarging and shrinking from scan to scan.   Scan in July 2007 showed 2 cm nodes.  Scan December 2007 show 1 cm nodes.  I'm confused!  Is this a false positive or could this really be cancer.  Doctor thinks nodes are responding to hormone therapy.
